intro: Melampyrum nemorosum subsp. nemorosum, commonly known as the wood betony, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Orobanchaceae family. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom from late spring to early summer. It typically grows in shaded, moist woodland areas and is often found in association with other shade-tolerant species. Its root system is fibrous, and it is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
